intro: Euclasta condylotricha, commonly known as the hairy leaf euclasta, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Euclasta condylotricha is often found in dry, open habitats such as woodlands and rocky areas.
